p: The Pimpinella anisum L is from the Umbelliferae family, a herbaceous annual plant, the most part of which is its green, pear‐shaped and small fruits that are found in Turkey, Iran, India, Egypt and many other tropical regions. This plant is used as a flavoring in the food and pharmaceutical industries (Al‐Bayati, 2008; Gulcin et al., 2003). Based on the research, anise essential oil contains anothole, eugenol, methylchavicol, anisaldehyde and estragole and anothole has been identified as an effective ingredient in anise essential oil (Abdel‐Reheem & Oraby, 2015).
